info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 31 at 3:05PM MDT until August 02 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR HOT TEMPERATURES, GUSTY WINDS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 112, 113, 114, 115, AND 117... The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a Red Flag Warning for hot temperatures, gusty winds, and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon Monday to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Eastern Glacier/Toole/Central/Eastern Pondera/Liberty, Hill and Blaine Counties, Lewis and Clark National Forest Rocky Mountain District-Rocky Mountain Front, Chouteau and Fergus Counties and Central and Eastern Lewis and Clark National Forest Areas. * TEMPERATURES...95 to 105 Monday and 90 to 95 Tuesday. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph Monday and 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent Monday and 15 to 20% Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any new fire starts could be difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Red Flag Warning.
